
An ancient bank encrypted its vault codes with RSA, but unknowingly used two Blum integers for keys. Recover the secret: 1688203918376988590258986150461964799739753357922129348295246042963271962349401441702212031826315799149991906073631877085112248813926039207247125481785166


The flag format is flag{...}
n=6909648101093496625407440320948717203057063833940985639140501062815205951541567660680923591687378691183411947768223898518706374032066087890090130289727037, e=1506989273345443942188244971256925968791743361902513208366434124858175480078110965114456035013643768776469249715661767114842165433429242346925317150093401
The lower 104 bits of p are: 84816588509103373278277328694833071571


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{zm017zji}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 1688203918376988590258986150461964799739753357922129348295246042963271962349401441702212031826315799149991906073631877085112248813926039207247125481785166
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6909648101093496625407440320948717203057063833940985639140501062815205951541567660680923591687378691183411947768223898518706374032066087890090130289727037, e=1506989273345443942188244971256925968791743361902513208366434124858175480078110965114456035013643768776469249715661767114842165433429242346925317150093401
The lower 104 bits of p are: 84816588509103373278277328694833071571

extra_info: p=111236188973365874652536283194743950885448964458960490946507967059818025600467, q=62116907859437059062968626720516544255602717880526469790953962495600124385711, Ï†(n)=6909648101093496625407440320948717203057063833940985639140501062815205951541394307584090788753663186273496687273082846836366887071328625960534712139740860
